channel.title: Phoenix
channel.description:
[ul][center][IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/23qrd5.png[/img][/center]
[center][url=http://up.ht/1hYnEFm] Download Source Files [/url][/center]
[center][size=10pt]Phoenix is an addition onto my prior framework Aero. Phoenix has had a lot of additional work done to make it even more user friendly.[/size][/center]
[size=14pt]New Content[/size] [list] [li]Global Object System. The creations are parsed from an external text file.[/li] [li]Character Customization. All changes are saved in the JSON file along-side all other data.[/li] [li]Skilling System. An abstract skilling system has been put in place to keep programming organized.[/li] [li]Bone Burying. Bone burying is completed and is using the latest skilling system.[/li] [li]Core Functionality. Many minor changes have been written into the core. Im not going to list them all since most are minor.[/li] [li]Level Up Interfaces. When a player increases a skill level the correct interface is shown.[/li] [li]Incoming & Outgoing Packets. Many Misc. packets have been registered.[/li] [/list]
[size=14pt]Standing Content[/size] [list][li]Floor Items. Turn global after 90 seconds and disappear after 180.[/li] [li]Player Rendering, Mob Rendering, Movement, Login, and Packet Reaction. (Obviously).[/li] [li]Nuked Core. The core is written in NIO and supported 2000 players and mobs within a 500 tile radius.[/li] [li]Banking. Supports inserting, swapping, withdrawing 1x, 5x, 10x, and a specified amount.[/li] [li]Equipment And Inventory. Supports switching and handles 2 handed weapons. [/li] [li]Mob support. Creations are parsed from an external text file with an easy to follow syntax. [/li] [li]Private Messaging. Supports logging in and out and sending private messages over the network. [/li] [li]Account Saving. Written with the JSON API for quick effective parsing of character files during run-time. [/li] [li]Thread Pooling. The core is based around a single thread pool which reads the amount of available processors you have for an adjusted performace.[/li] [li]Outgoing Packets. Outgoing packets are abstracted out to avoid the clutter of a giant static based file.[/li] [li]Incoming Packets. Incoming packets use annotation to assign opcodes to specified handlers. [/li] [li]Running & Walking. Correct accurate formulas the support changing of states while in motion (No walk-back algorithim).[/li] [li]No global state is used, everything uses polymorphism as a substitute.[/li] [li]String Layers. String layers are parsed from an external text file to avoid any clutter in an initialization method. [/li] [li]Built light-weight without all the dead code and unused methods. [/li] [li]Attribute system to avoid an access of variables. [/li] [li]All content is current pulse driven and should be written as such. [/li] [li]Container for Equipment, Inventory, and Banking to avoid any bulk in a single class. [/li] [li]Teleporting and region changing. Updates for everyone within your bounds. [/li] [li]Weapon interfaces. For every weapon the correct interface is displayed. [/li][/list]
[center]
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2iizt5k.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/154abdj.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/20h6po1.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2e5o03o.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2lwvxnr.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/fknzub.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2py0swo.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2re2j9h.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/2qi2rly.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/spbz81.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2qd8y75.png[/img]
[size=6pt]My old topic Aero was coincidentally bumped about ten minutes after I posted this. If a mod wants to delete my old topic that would be nice.[/size]
[size=6pt]Credits:
Ryley - Design plotting and urged me to learn about annotation.
Sinisoul - Referenced your outgoing packet design from Evelus.
Lare - Design plotting.[/size][/ul]

item.title: Phoenix
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

Partially renamed 317 Client (Client I used when writing it) : http://up.ht/1fg7uop

If your trying to use a client loading higher revision data make sure to make the correct protocol changes. I assume most clients
are having issues since head icons aren’t added into the updating routine. Simply add another byte for head icons under the byte dispatching the player’s gender in PlayerUpdateListenerEvent.java

Read full topic

item.title: Phoenix
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

KroniKz_:

Question. What is the Attribute system?

It holds attributes like flags and values. People generally use Attribute systems because they are cleaner and they save memory. I can’t really explain it well but here, instead of:

[code=java]private boolean isFarming;

public void farming() {
isFarming = true;

 if(isFarming) {
     // do something
 }

}[/code]

you can do:

[code=java]
public void farming() {
player.getAttributes().put(“farming”, true);

 if(player.getAttributes().get("farming")) {
      // do something
 }

}[/code]

I personally didn’t really like them all that much, but I’m rethinking it now I might make my own attribute system for Asteria. Keeps things clean and prevents things like this:

[code=java] public int essenceAmount = 0;

    public int cook = 0;

    public int offensiveWords = 0;

    public boolean isWalkingAction = false;

    public boolean lastRange = false;

    public boolean isBusy = false;

    public boolean hittingDummy = false;

    public int numberofcorrectexercises = 0;
    public String exercisedia;
    public int objectmatid = 0;
    public boolean pickedcorrectexercise = true;
    public boolean isexercising;
    public String exercisedia2;
    public int objectx;
    public int objecty;
    public int drillemote;
    public int assignedexercise;

    public boolean canAttack = true;
    public boolean stopAttack = false;
    public boolean isWalking;
    public boolean isMoving = false;
    public int attackDelay = 0;
    public int arrows = 0;
    public boolean enemyIsDied = false;
    public int damage;
    public long lastNPCHit;
    public int lastNPCType = 0;

    public boolean random = false;
    public int mimeTimes = 0;

    public boolean walking = false;
    public boolean clickingmap = false;
    public String sendplayername;
    public int skillSelected;
    public int playerWeight = 0;
    public int be4randomX = 0;
    public int be4randomY = 0;
    public int be4randomHeight = 0;
    public int stopspam = 0;
    public int runtab = 0;
    public int clickemote = 0;
    public int wrenchtab = 0;
    public int dialoguespam = 0;
    public int subtractthread = 0;
    public boolean ispottery;
    public boolean check1;
    public boolean check2;
    public boolean check3;
    public boolean isCutting;
    public boolean UseBow = false;
    public int flashsidebar = 0;
    public int spellnumber = 50;
    public boolean tutspeaking;
    public int randomevent = 0;

    public int teleBlockTimer = 0;
    public boolean changedRegion;
    public boolean hansyelling;
    public int treeglitchfix = 0;
    public int playertotreeabsX = 0;
    public int playertotreeabsY = 0;
    public int weaponId;
    public double expRate;
    public int objectId;
    public int emoteId;
    public long toolValue;
    public int expAmount;
    public long Delay;
    public long otherDelay;
    public long soundDelay;
    public int soundId;
    public long lastSuccess;
    public int otherId;
    public int extraId;
    public long RealSoundDelay;
    public int levelId;
    public int number;
    public String name;
    public boolean charDesign;
    public boolean designInterfaceOpened;
   
    public int enemyIndex;
    public int combatDelay;
   
    public int skillNumber;
    public int skillNumber2;
    public boolean isWoodcutting;
    public boolean isMining;
    public boolean isFishing;
    public boolean isFiremaking;
    public boolean isCooking;
    public boolean isSmithing;
    public boolean isSmelting;
    public boolean isCrafting;
    public int playerNumber;
   
    public int skillObjectX;
    public int skillObjectY;
    public ArrayList skillTimerList = new ArrayList();
    public ArrayList skillXCoord = new ArrayList();
    public ArrayList skillYCoord = new ArrayList();
    public ArrayList skillObjectID = new ArrayList();

    public long plantDelay;
    public int plantID = -1;
    public int pickPlant;
    public int npcX;
    public int npcY;

    public int objectX;
    public int objectY;
    public int ObjectID;

    public int npcHP;
    public int followThisPlayer;
    public boolean tutorialisland;
    public int refreshbar = 0;
    public boolean tutbarnotopened;
    public int backpacktabshown = 0;

    public boolean haslogged = false;
    public boolean hasAccepted = false;
    public int song = 0;
    public int hasputgrainin = 0;
    public int hasputgrainin2 = 0;
    public int graindownshoot = 0;
    public int MusicOn = 1;
    public int startedmusic = 0;
    public int TradeLogout = 0;
    public int maxedStats = 0;
    public boolean iscuttingtreeontutorialisland;
    public boolean ismakingfireontutorialisland;
    public boolean shownpack;
    public boolean isfishingontutorialisland;
    public boolean iscookingontutorialisland;
    public int wrenchtabicon = 0;
    public int questtabicon = 0;
    public int delay8228 = 0;
    public boolean talkingtoquestguide;
    public boolean prospectingtin;
    public boolean prospectingcopper;
    public boolean miningtin;
    public boolean miningcopper;
    public boolean smeltingbronzebar;
    public boolean wornequipment;
    public boolean theseareyourcombatstyles;
    public boolean isattackingrat;
    public boolean madefirstkill;
    public boolean bowsandarrowsdelay;
    public boolean openingbanktutisland;
    public boolean shownignorelist;
    public int shownignorelist2 = 0;
    public boolean gettinglogs;
    public boolean cookingdough;
    public boolean talkingtomage;
    public int antispamclick = 0;
    public int treeinfo;

    public boolean musicplayer;
    public boolean hasspawnedrestless;
    public boolean wnorth;
    public boolean wwest;
    public boolean weast;
    public boolean wsouth;
    public boolean doorfacingcheck;
    public int north = 0;
    public int east = 0;
    public int south = 0;

    public boolean doingsomething;
    public int talkedblackkdoor = 0;
    public int moveX;
    public int moveY;
    public boolean arrow2;
    public long entangleDelay, lastEntangle;
    public long walkDelay, lastWalk;
    public long lastIncrease;

    public long lastSave = System.currentTimeMillis();
    public long statIncrease = System.currentTimeMillis();
    public long mageDelay;
    public long vengDelay;
    public long lastBookSwitch;
    public int playerIsVisible = 1; // Gnarly: Player is visible, 1 = true, 0 =
                                                                    // false.
    public boolean Telerunes;
    public boolean Telerunes2;
    public long increaseTimer;
    public long foodDelay;
    public long potionDelay;
    public long lastSpecial;
    public boolean splash;
    [/code]

item.title: Phoenix
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

[ul][center][/center]

[center] Download Source Files [/center]

[center][size=10pt]Phoenix is an addition onto my prior framework Aero. Phoenix has had a lot of additional work done to make it even more user friendly.[/size][/center]

[size=14pt]New Content[/size]
[list]
[li]Global Object System. The creations are parsed from an external text file.[/li]
[li]Character Customization. All changes are saved in the JSON file along-side all other data.[/li]
[li]Skilling System. An abstract skilling system has been put in place to keep programming organized.[/li]
[li]Bone Burying. Bone burying is completed and is using the latest skilling system.[/li]
[li]Core Functionality. Many minor changes have been written into the core. Im not going to list them all since most are minor.[/li]
[li]Level Up Interfaces. When a player increases a skill level the correct interface is shown.[/li]
[li]Incoming & Outgoing Packets. Many Misc. packets have been registered.[/li]
[/list]

[size=14pt]Standing Content[/size]
[list][li]Floor Items. Turn global after 90 seconds and disappear after 180.[/li]
[li]Player Rendering, Mob Rendering, Movement, Login, and Packet Reaction. (Obviously).[/li]
[li]Nuked Core. The core is written in NIO and supported 2000 players and mobs within a 500 tile radius.[/li]
[li]Banking. Supports inserting, swapping, withdrawing 1x, 5x, 10x, and a specified amount.[/li]
[li]Equipment And Inventory. Supports switching and handles 2 handed weapons. [/li]
[li]Mob support. Creations are parsed from an external text file with an easy to follow syntax. [/li]
[li]Private Messaging. Supports logging in and out and sending private messages over the network. [/li]
[li]Account Saving. Written with the JSON API for quick effective parsing of character files during run-time. [/li]
[li]Thread Pooling. The core is based around a single thread pool which reads the amount of available processors you have for an adjusted performace.[/li]
[li]Outgoing Packets. Outgoing packets are abstracted out to avoid the clutter of a giant static based file.[/li]
[li]Incoming Packets. Incoming packets use annotation to assign opcodes to specified handlers. [/li]
[li]Running & Walking. Correct accurate formulas the support changing of states while in motion (No walk-back algorithim).[/li]
[li]No global state is used, everything uses polymorphism as a substitute.[/li]
[li]String Layers. String layers are parsed from an external text file to avoid any clutter in an initialization method. [/li]
[li]Built light-weight without all the dead code and unused methods. [/li]
[li]Attribute system to avoid an access of variables. [/li]
[li]All content is current pulse driven and should be written as such. [/li]
[li]Container for Equipment, Inventory, and Banking to avoid any bulk in a single class. [/li]
[li]Teleporting and region changing. Updates for everyone within your bounds. [/li]
[li]Weapon interfaces. For every weapon the correct interface is displayed. [/li][/list]

[center]

[size=6pt]My old topic Aero was coincidentally bumped about ten minutes after I posted this. If a mod wants to delete my old topic that would be nice.[/size]

[size=6pt]Credits:

Ryley - Design plotting and urged me to learn about annotation.

Sinisoul - Referenced your outgoing packet design from Evelus.

Lare - Design plotting.[/size][/ul]

Read full topic
